comment: Professor Kang was absolutely amazing. I had a few technological issues but she was very understanding. Every email was responded to within 24 hours with solutions and follow ups. The only downside is that the tests have more weight than most classes but she allows 2 attempts and the use of a notecard Front and Back. Definitely would recomend her!

Okay so I have Ms. Kang for Pre calculus, the accent is pretty hard to understand especially while learning math. If you get this professor then just actually put in the work and study, don't just use ai for it, you will be fine!!! 
She does allow a 3x5 notebook card front and back for tests (except final) so that was a huge help.

Professor Kang has truly been a godsend this semester. I had issues with getting classes as this was my first summer semester but she has been nothing but helpful and respectful. She is very clear and quick with her emails and gives grace when life happens. She's absolutely amazing and I recommend her 100% 10/10

If you cannot teach yourself DO NOT take her class. She doesn't explain things well. Its really hard to understand her sometimes. However, she does let you use a note card during tests. If you like using ALEKS, she is an okay professor.

The professor is super sweet and understanding. She's always open to answering questions during and after class. Multiple times, she moved the due date if a lot of people were falling behind. Homework is on ALEKS, and she let us use notes on a flashcard during the tests.

Might just be the sweetest math professor you meet, super understanding of late work, she gives a million chances to turn in work and will cancel class if it she thinks students might have a hard time coming. Only reason you wouldn't end up with an A+ in this class is if you don't try

accent is understandable, she just goes a bit fast because nobody asks questions. very understanding and fair. her tests are kinda short so more weight on each question. very sweet and friendly and you could tell she's passionate and very knowledgable.

I was doing super bad on the exams for her class until she started using extra credit it literally saved my grade. She was also really nice and offered tons of methods to try and help. Really great professor, I just wasn't good at the subject. She does talk a little fast sometimes, but that's literally it.

Has somewhat of an accent, but its good enough to understand. Random attendance checks, and ALEKS (online practice) as homework every unit, which can be long and boring. No one talks, even though she tries to foster a communicative environment. Entire class was the same as my HS pre-calculus curriculum, easy if you try. Good Prof, Boring Class.

She has a really strong accent with makes it hard to learn from. I ended up teaching myself through aleks. The only reason I got a B is because  she gives attendance checks throughout class but either doesn't really make everyone aware about it or she puts it before class even starts or after class so be aware of that! She's nice!

Her accent makes is hard to understand and makes it hard to learn. I ended up having to teach myself through the Aleks modules. she is very kind however and is accessible outside of class but the accent made it hard to actually learn. the class material was very influential on the tests and is very important to actually know your materials.

Shes a really sweet professor. If you talk to her shes lenient and willing to help you. All the homework were on Aleks and she drops the lowest prerequisite and replaced the lowest test grade with the final. Her accent makes it a little difficult to understand but she is really sweet and if you ask questions she explains it thoroughly. TAKE HER
